bug.short_desc: Firefox default context menu shown in some circumstances

long_desc.thetext:
Under some circumstances the default Firefox context menu is shown even though it should have been disabled by calls to stopPropagation and preventDefault.
Tools > Options, Content, Advanced JS options has "Disable or replace context menus" checked however a right-click shows the qooxdoo-generated context menu underneath the browser menu. Single-stepping the code shows that the browser menu appears after the event has been processed.
This appears to be dependent on circumstances. A "build" version doesn't show it, the "source" version does. And then it stops altogether.
See http://www.nabble.com/Context-menu-in-Firefox-not-suppressed-in-0.7.2--tf4507833.html for a discussion and reports from other users.
Hugh
That sounds new to me. Interesting however. We will need more time for investigation here. Changed target to 0.7.3.
For us (the RAP project, http://eclipse.org/rap) it would be *highly* desirable to get this fixed until our 1.0 release is due on Oct, 10. Is there any timeframe yet?

Summary: The bug is that the context menu is sometimes shown even when it is disabled globally using the qooxdoo EventHandler.
